name: BaseFrame
oneLiner: AI agents for hardware design that catch risks and tradeoffs early

metadata.industry: B2B / B2B -> Engineering, Product and Design

keyFacts.tam: EDA market: ~$19-20B (2025); BOM software market: ~$8-9B (2024) â€” sources: Mordor Intelligence, Spherical Insights
keyFacts.sam: No public data found; subset of BOM/component engineering for electronics hardware teams
keyFacts.revenue_signal: Custom-quote pricing model for teams; no published pricing tiers or revenue figures
keyFacts.founders: Anshul Paul: UC Berkeley M.E.T., Founding Engineer at HappyRobot (YC); Vaibhav Agrawal: UC Berkeley CS, Sutter Hill Ventures Codepoint Fellow (Sigma Computing, Augment Code)
keyFacts.competitors: CELUS ($27.4M), CircuitMind ($17.4M), Quilter ($35M+), SnapMagic ($4.7M), JITX ($12.1M), Altium (acquired ~$5.9B)
keyFacts.moat_signals: Workflow embedding in Slack/Teams (switching costs); accumulating component/design data; pre-design scoping niche not addressed by incumbents
keyFacts.risk_factors: Limited hardware domain expertise on founding team, well-funded competitors in adjacent space, incumbent EDA players adding AI features
keyFacts.founder_reach: Anshul Paul: LinkedIn 500+ connections; Vaibhav Agrawal: LinkedIn 500+ connections. No confirmed Twitter/X or notable GitHub repos for either founder
keyFacts.distribution_signals: No Product Hunt launch found; no app store listings; no confirmed company Twitter/X; LinkedIn company page exists but follower count unavailable; product distributed via Slack/Teams integrations
